comments_since_last_sample.body:
As a reminder, this subreddit [is for civil discussion.](/r/politics/wiki/index#wiki_be_civil)

In general, be courteous to others. Debate/discuss/argue the merits of ideas, don't attack people. Personal insults, shill or troll accusations, hate speech, any suggestion or support of harm, violence, or death, and other rule violations can result in a permanent ban. 

If you see comments in violation of our rules, please report them.

 For those who have questions regarding any media outlets being posted on this subreddit, please click [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/politics/wiki/approveddomainslist) to review our details as to our approved domains list and outlet criteria.

***


*I am a bot, and this action was performed automatically. Please [contact the moderators of this subreddit](/message/compose/?to=/r/politics) if you have any questions or concerns.*

I understand that while I'm on the clock, I am expected to perform my job AND abstain from certain behaviors because the company is paying me specifically for those things.  Now, if the company wants me to abstain from certain behaviors, such as smoking weed or discussing with my coworkers the ways in which we're getting fucked, shouldn't the company be paying me for that?  Shouldn't I be getting paid for every minute I have to abide by company rules?  If not, then the company needs to shut the fuck up about what we do off-the-clock because punishing us for not complying when we aren't at work is either wage theft or attempted slavery.
Big fines. lol Better be in the billions to make any sort of difference at all. "Price of doing business" as the corporate robots like to say.
oh no how will big corporation pay 100,000 dollars?!?

Just like they were close to cancelling student debt, or giving us paid family leave. 

The Democratic party is basically the republicans with a BLM sticker. Fuck the democrats and fuck our entire government system. I’ll never vote Democrat again.

Big fines fines big enough to actually discourage the behavior?

And that's a rhetorical question, because we all know the answer.
too little too late - Democrats had a window for more radical action it's lost now.
Fines need to be in percentage. Break a law and you have to pay a fine of 15% or something.  Fuck those $ 30,000 fines . For an Amazon kind of company that's not even on their radar.

Given how the courts have ruled about union access being an illegal taking, I suspect scotus is about to kill all unions forever.

And also probably regulatory enforcement on premesis.
I approve.   While groups like Amazon may not think this is a BFD, individual franchise owners may think again.
Lately Democrats are an asymptote.  Constantly approaching something but never actually arriving.
Great. Now let’s do something about legal union busting.
They're always close to doing something good and then never actually doing it.
I'll believe it when I see it. Sinema and Munchin will probably just kill it like every other good thing we're supposed to be doing right now.
